intro: Gynoxys tabaconasensis, commonly known as the Tabaconas beauty, is a species of flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Gynoxys tabaconasensis is often found growing in shaded, humid environments, where it thrives in the understory of dense forests.
